      Gets the influence of a Player on the current island

      p - The player to check influence of
      Returns:
      the influence of the player
      Throws:
      IslandSkippedInfluenceForStopCardException - If there was a Stop card and we could not compute the influence

    • changeControlOfCurrentIsland

      public void changeControlOfCurrentIsland(Player from, Player to) throws IslandSkippedControlAssignmentForStopCardException, IllegalArgumentException
      Changes control of the current island from the player that previously controlled it to the new Player This method performs both the control change (tower placement on the Island) and Tower reassignment to the Player that owns that Tower color. This means that if the match is a Team match, you will need to pass the Player that owns the Towers (and not the one that is effectively controlling the Island).
      Parameters:
      from - The Player that previously owned the Island. You can pass null, but only if the Island did not have a Tower before
      to - The Player that will gain control of the Island (or in a Team match, the Player of the team that owns the Towers). This parameter cannot be null.
      Throws:
      IslandSkippedControlAssignmentForStopCardException - If the Island had a Stop Card on it before the start of this turn, thus the control change will not occur.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are incorrect (e.g.: if from is null but the Island already has an Island, or if from is not the Player that previously controlled the Island). x
